required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Novel Device for Ultrasound-guided Pediatric Vessel Cannulations
clinical_study.official_title: Novel Device for Ultrasound-guided Pediatric Vessel Cannulations

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical Trial to investigate whether the use of a novel device to be used in conjunction with ultrasound in pediatric vessel cannulations is superior to ultrasound-only pediatric vessel cannulations in terms of number of cannulation attempts.

detailed_description.textblock: Use of needle guidance plus ultrasound imaging for CVC placement in the pediatric high-risk population may facilitate the procedure with a single needle pass and decrease the incidence of adverse effects by minimizing additional needle passes. This study will compare the use of ultrasound-only guidance with the Clear Guide SCENERGY guidance in terms of successful first-attempt vessel cannulations such as internal jugular and fermoral artery access. The question is whether it is possible to make ultrasound-guided pediatric vascular access less technically challenging in order to improve adoption and utilization leading to decreased iatrogenic complications and improved patient safety.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: two-arm study, comparing ultrasound-only pediatric vessel cannulations versus SCENERGY-guided pediatric vessel cannulations
study_design_info.masking_description: Because the SCENERGY is an attachment to the ultrasound probe, it cannot be masked.

primary_outcome.description: Test if the vessel cannulation was successful with only 1 attempt --needle puncture--to reach the vessel

secondary_outcome.measure: Non-IR Personnel Successfully Cannulate Pediatric Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Test if non-specialists can learn to successfully cannulate pediatric patients with only 1 needle puncture.
Test whether the SCENERGY makes possible successful pediatric vessel cannulations at patient's point of care location.

clinical_study.condition: Clinical Procedures Which Require Vessel Cannulations in Pediatric Patients

arm_group.description: The standard of care for vessel cannulation currently employed at CNMC
The addition of the SCENERGY guidance combined with the ultrasound for pediatric vessel cannulations.

intervention.description: Use of the SCENERGY guidance device in conjunction with ultrasound to guide needles for pediatric vessel cannulations

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- any pediatric patient scheduled for a vessel cannulation at CNMC
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
